member.name: T:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.MessageEncoding
member.summary: Outgoing message encoding.

member.name: F:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.MessageEncoding.Unknown
member.summary: Unknown encoding

member.name: F:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.MessageEncoding.Gsm7
member.summary: "gsm7" is the default alfabet for text messages and when using gsm7, a single sms message can contain 160 characters. If the length exceeeds 160 characters, the message is actually split up into parts of 153 characters and charged according to this. Please note, that a few, specific characters fill up 2 bytes and count for 2 letters. Ref: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/GSM_03.38

member.name: F:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.MessageEncoding.Ucs2
member.summary: "ucs2"" allows for more non-roman characters to be used along with smileys. When using this encoding, a single message can consist of 70 characters. If the message exceeds 70 characters, the final message is actually split into parts of 67 characters.

member.name: F:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.MessageEncoding.Auto
member.summary: "auto" can be used in case the sender wishes to support non-roman characters but wants to save the expenses on all the trafic that only contains gsm characters anyway.

member.name: T:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.Method
member.summary: Http method types

member.name: T:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.MessageCancelInfo
member.summary: Information needed to cancel an outgoing text message.

member.name: M:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.MessageCancelInfo.#ctor(InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.OutgoingMessageId)
member.summary: Create a new cancel-object
member.param: The id of the message to cancel

member.name: T:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.CancelMessageResult
member.summary: Represents the result of a cancel attempt.

member.name: P:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.CancelMessageResult.MessageId
member.summary: The id of the outgoing message.

member.name: P:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.CancelMessageResult.ResultCode
member.summary: The code specifying whether the cancel was a success or not.

member.name: P:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.CancelMessageResult.ResultDescription
member.summary: A readable description of the result.

member.name: T:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.CancelResultCode
member.summary: Cancel result code

member.name: F:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.CancelResultCode.Unknown
member.summary: Unknown

member.name: F:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.CancelResultCode.Success
member.summary: The message was successfully cancelled.

member.name: F:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.CancelResultCode.NotCancelled
member.summary: The message was found but not cancelled. This can happen if the message has already been sent.

member.name: F:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.CancelResultCode.MessageNotFound
member.summary: The message id specified did not match any messages in the database. This can happen if the id was not valid or if the message was deleted in the system.

member.name: T:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.ChargeInfo
member.summary: Information related to charging of an outgoing message.

member.name: P:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.ChargeInfo.IsCharged
member.summary: True if the message will be charged.

member.name: P:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.ChargeInfo.SmsCount
member.summary: The total sms count in the message. If IsCharged is true, this is the number of sms'es that will be charged.

member.name: P:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.ChargeInfo.Network
member.summary: The network of which the message belongs.

member.name: P:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.ChargeInfo.Encoding
member.summary: The encoding of the message. Can be either "gsm7" or "ucs2". In case the message was submitted with encoding "auto", this report will reveal the final encoding based on the characters in the message text. "gsm7" is the default alfabet for text messages and when using gsm7, a single sms message can contain 160 characters. If the length exceeeds 160 characters, the message is actually split up into parts of 153 characters and charged according to this. Please note, that a few, specific characters fill up 2 bytes and count for 2 letters. Ref: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/GSM_03.38 "ucs2"" allows for more non-roman characters to be used along with smileys. When using this encoding, a single message can consist of 70 characters. If the message exceeds 70 characters, the final message is actually split into parts of 67 characters.

member.name: T:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.DeliveryInfo
member.summary: Information related to the delivery of an outgoing message.

member.name: P:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.DeliveryInfo.StateCode
member.summary: Specification of the delivery state

member.name: P:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.DeliveryInfo.StateDescription
member.summary: A human readable description of the state.

member.name: P:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.DeliveryInfo.SendTime
member.summary: A human readable description of the state.

member.name: P:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.DeliveryInfo.ErrorCode
member.summary: A code describing the type of error.

member.name: P:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.DeliveryInfo.ErrorDescription
member.summary: A description describing the error if the state is not "DELIVERED". This property will be absent in case the state is "DELIVERED".

member.name: T:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.StatusReport
member.summary: A status report for an outgoing message.

member.name: P:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.StatusReport.MessageId
member.summary: The id of the message.

member.name: P:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.StatusReport.NumberDetails
member.summary: The detailed number information.

member.name: P:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.StatusReport.DeliveryInfo
member.summary: Information about the delivery state of the outgoing message.

member.name: P:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.StatusReport.ChargeInfo
member.summary: Charging info about the outgoing message.

member.name: T:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.OutgoingSmsTemplateCreateInfo
member.summary: Information for creating a new outgoing message using a template.

member.name: P:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.OutgoingSmsTemplateCreateInfo.TemplateId
member.summary: The id of the template to use.

member.name: P:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.OutgoingSmsTemplateCreateInfo.Messages
member.summary: A list of the sms messages to be sent. Allowed to contain between 1 and 250 elements.

member.name: T:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.OutgoingSmsTemplateCreateResult
member.summary: Result info for a created outgoing message using template.

member.name: P:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.OutgoingSmsTemplateCreateResult.UsedPlaceholderKeys
member.summary: A list of used used placeholder keys.

member.name: P:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.OutgoingSmsTemplateCreateResult.NotUsedPlaceholderKeys
member.summary: A list of not used placeholder keys.

member.name: T:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.OutgoingSmsTemplateMessageCreateInfo
member.summary: Create information for message for sending SMS using template.

member.name: P:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.OutgoingSmsTemplateMessageCreateInfo.To
member.summary: The msisdn (country code and number) to send to. (Remember to include countrycode in all numbers, e.g. 4512345678). If max length is exceeded, the entire api call will fail.

member.name: P:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.OutgoingSmsTemplateMessageCreateInfo.CountryHint
member.summary: For optimal phone number validation, we encourage you to provide us with a country code. This can be the numeric country code (like 44) or the two-letter suffix (like GB). If this field is empty it is important that you add the country code (e.g 44) in front of the phone number in “to”.

member.name: P:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.OutgoingSmsTemplateMessageCreateInfo.MessageId
member.summary: An optional message id used to identify the message. If no message id is provided, a new message id is generated and assigned to the message. This id must be unique across all messages created on the same account. (In case a previous message has been deleted according to GDPR deletion rules setup on the specific account, the messageId is allowed to be reused) If max length is exceeded, the entire api call will fail. Max length: 50

member.name: P:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.OutgoingSmsTemplateMessageCreateInfo.RespectBlacklist
member.summary: If true, this message will be blocked from sending if the target number is on the account's blacklist. If false, the message will be sent no matter blacklist settings. Default: true

member.name: P:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.OutgoingSmsTemplateMessageCreateInfo.ValidityPeriodInSeconds
member.summary: The validity period in seconds. Minimum is 60 seconds and maximum is 172800 (48 hours). If not specified, the messages is attempted to be delivered in 48 hours.

member.name: P:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.OutgoingSmsTemplateMessageCreateInfo.StatusCallbackUrl
member.summary: An optional callback url. If specified, this url is called with a status report when the message has reached its final status (either delivered, failed or cancelled). NOTE: Callbacks happen in bulks.Reports for message with identical callback urls can happen to be grouped in single callbacks.

member.name: P:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.OutgoingSmsTemplateMessageCreateInfo.SendTime
member.summary: If specified, this represents the future send time of the message.

member.name: P:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.OutgoingSmsTemplateMessageCreateInfo.Placeholders
member.summary: A key-value list of placeholders to replace in the template text. Keys must be encapsulated with {}. E.g. {NAME}.

member.name: T:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.OutgoingSmsMessageCreateInfo
member.summary: Information for creating a new outgoing message.

member.name: P:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.OutgoingSmsMessageCreateInfo.To
member.summary: The msisdn (country code and number) to send to. (Remember to include countrycode in all numbers, e.g. 4512345678). If max length is exceeded, the entire api call will fail.

member.name: P:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.OutgoingSmsMessageCreateInfo.CountryHint
member.summary: For optimal phone number validation, we encourage you to provide us with a country code. This can be the numeric country code (like 44) or the two-letter suffix (like GB). If this field is empty it is important that you add the country code (e.g 44) in front of the phone number in “to”.

member.name: P:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.OutgoingSmsMessageCreateInfo.Text
member.summary: The text message. If the max length is exceeded (10,000 chars), the message text is truncated and sent.
member.example: "This is a message text to be sent"

member.name: P:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.OutgoingSmsMessageCreateInfo.From
member.summary: The sender. This can either be a 3-11 chars text sender or an up to 14 digit long sender number. If the max length is exceeded, the string is truncated.

member.name: P:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.OutgoingSmsMessageCreateInfo.MessageId
member.summary: An optional message id used to identify the message. If no message id is provided, a new message id is generated and assigned to the message. This id must be unique across all messages created on the same account. (In case a previous message has been deleted according to GDPR deletion rules setup on the specific account, the messageId is allowed to be reused) If max length is exceeded, the entire api call will fail. Max length: 50

member.name: P:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.OutgoingSmsMessageCreateInfo.RespectBlacklist
member.summary: If true, this message will be blocked from sending if the target number is on the account's blacklist. If false, the message will be sent no matter blacklist settings. Default: true

member.name: P:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.OutgoingSmsMessageCreateInfo.Flash
member.summary: If true, the message will be shown as a flash message (also known as a class0 message) on the target phone. If false, it will be received as a standard text message. Default: false

member.name: P:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.OutgoingSmsMessageCreateInfo.Encoding
member.summary: The encoding of the message. Can be either "gsm7", "ucs2" or "auto". "gsm7" is the default alfabet for text messages and when using gsm7, a single sms message can contain 160 characters. If the length exceeeds 160 characters, the message is actually split up into parts of 153 characters and charged according to this. Please note, that a few, specific characters fill up 2 bytes and count for 2 letters. Ref: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/GSM_03.38 "ucs2"" allows for more non-roman characters to be used along with smileys. When using this encoding, a single message can consist of 70 characters. If the message exceeds 70 characters, the final message is actually split into parts of 67 characters. "auto" can be used in case the sender wishes to support non-roman characters but wants to save the expenses on all the trafic that only contains gsm characters anyway. Default: "gsm7"

member.name: P:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.OutgoingSmsMessageCreateInfo.RawEncoding
member.summary: The actual string value of the encoding that will be sent over the API.

member.name: P:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.OutgoingSmsMessageCreateInfo.ValidityPeriodInSeconds
member.summary: The validity period in seconds. Minimum is 60 seconds and maximum is 172800 (48 hours). If not specified, the messages is attempted to be delivered in 48 hours.

member.name: P:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.OutgoingSmsMessageCreateInfo.StatusCallbackUrl
member.summary: An optional callback url. If specified, this url is called with a status report when the message has reached its final status (either delivered, failed or cancelled). NOTE: Callbacks happen in bulks.Reports for message with identical callback urls can happen to be grouped in single callbacks.

member.name: P:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.OutgoingSmsMessageCreateInfo.SendTime
member.summary: If specified, this represents the future send time of the message.

member.param: The msisdn (country code and number) to send to. (Remember to include countrycode in all numbers, e.g. 4512345678). If max length is exceeded, the entire api call will fail.
The text message. If the max length is exceeded (10,000 chars), the message text is truncated and sent.
The sender. This can either be a 3-11 chars text sender or an up to 14 digit long sender number. If the max length is exceeded, the string is truncated.

/// An optional message id used to identify the message. If no message id is provided, a new message id is generated and assigned to the message. This id must be unique across all messages created on the same account. (In case a previous message has been deleted according to GDPR deletion rules setup on the specific account, the messageId is allowed to be reused). If max length is exceeded, the entire api call will fail. Max length: 50
If true, this message will be blocked from sending if the target number is on the account's blacklist. If false, the message will be sent no matter blacklist settings.
If true, the message will be shown as a flash message (also known as a class0 message) on the target phone. If false, it will be received as a standard text message.
The encoding of the message.

The validity period. If the message cannot be delivered within this time frame it is dropped an concidered failed. Minimum is 60 seconds and maximum is 172800 (48 hours). If not specified, the messages is attempted to be delivered in 48 hours.
An optional callback url. If specified, this url is called with a status report when the message has reached its final status (either delivered, failed or cancelled).
If specified, this message will be sent at the specified time in the future.

For optimal phone number validation, we encourage you to provide us with a country code. This can be the numeric country code (like 44) or the two-letter suffix (like GB). If this field is empty it is important that you add the country code (e.g 44) in front of the phone number in “to”.

member.name: T:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.OutgoingSmsMessageCreateResult
member.summary: Result info for a created outgoing message.

member.name: P:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.OutgoingSmsMessageCreateResult.NumberDetails
member.summary: The parsed details about the msisdn provided in the to-field of the request (msisdn is a number with a countrycode e.g. 4512345678)

member.name: P:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.OutgoingSmsMessageCreateResult.Text
member.summary: The text message. If the max length is exceeded (10,000 chars), the message text is truncated and sent.

member.name: P:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.OutgoingSmsMessageCreateResult.From
member.summary: The sender. This can either be a 3-11 chars text sender or an up to 14 digit long sender number. If the max length is exceeded, the string is truncated.

member.name: P:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.OutgoingSmsMessageCreateResult.SmsCount
member.summary: The number of sms messages this message will be split into when sent to the operator. Charging will also be done according to this number.

member.name: P:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.OutgoingSmsMessageCreateResult.MessageId
member.summary: An optional message id used to identify the message. If no message id was provided when sending the message, a new message id has been generated and assigned to the message. This id is unique across all messages created on the same account.

member.name: P:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.OutgoingSmsMessageCreateResult.Encoding
member.summary: The encoding of the message. Can be either "gsm7", "ucs2" or "auto".

member.name: T:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.OutgoingMessageId
member.summary: The id type used for outgoing messages.

member.name: M:InMobile.Sms.ApiClient.ISmsOutgoingApiMethod.GetStatusReports(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get 1 or more pending status reports awaiting to be fetched. After calling this method, the returned reports will be flagged as processed and never returned again.
member.param: The maximum amount of reports to receive. Limit bust be between 1 and 250.
